Package sample.controller

Class AppointmentManager

java.lang.Object
sample.controller.AppointmentManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class AppointmentManager extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class creates a scene where you can manage appointments. You can add, update, and delete appointments as needed.

    • fillAllFields

      public void fillAllFields(Appointment selection)
      this method fills the fields with selected customer information. once filled, they can be altered, and updated within the database.

    • loadAllTables

      public void loadAllTables()
      this method populates all 3 tables with appointment information from the database.

    • fillComboBoxes

      public void fillComboBoxes()
      This method sets items in each of the comboboxes. it also sets the appointment ID

    • clearFields

      public void clearFields()
      this method clears all text fields and comboboxes.

    • onExitButton

      public void onExitButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)

    • onNewAppointment

      public void onNewAppointment(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      this method allows you to create a new appointment. if there is an existing appointment selected it is unselected and its information is cleared from the textfields and comboboxes
      Parameters:
      actionEvent -

    • onDeleteAppointment

      public void onDeleteAppointment(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws SQLException
      this method deletes the appointment of your choice. if no appointment is selected it does nothing.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent -
      Throws:
      SQLException

      Throws:

    • onSaveAppointment

      public void onSaveAppointment(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws SQLException
      this method saves user input into the appointments within the database. if there is invalid input it displays error messages and does not save.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent -
      Throws:
      SQLException
